title: Datadog's stock soars in debut, with first trade 49% above IPO price
text: Datadog Inc. DDOG, +39.07% got off to a great start as a public company, as the stock opened 49.4% above the the digital transformation and cloud migration software company's $27 initial public offering price. The stock's first trade was at $40.35 at 11:57 a.m. Eastern for 3.2 million shares. It has extended gains since the open to be up 51% in recent trading. The IPO priced late Wednesday above the expected range of $24 to $26, which was recently raised from a range of $19 to $22. The company sole 24 million shares to raise $648 million in the IPO, and could raise up to $745.2 million if the underwriters exercise all the options to buy additional shares. The company has gone public at a time the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, -0.07% has rallied 31% year to date and the S&P 500 SPX, +0.00% has advanced 20%.
